intro: Pelargonium pseudosetulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and clusters of small, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
